text.section: The Commissioner may suspend or revoke a certificate of qualification for any ground listed in § 10-126 of this article.

Instead of or in addition to denying, refusing to renew, suspending, or revoking a certificate of qualification, the Commissioner may:
impose a penalty of not less than $100 but not exceeding $50,000 for each violation of this article;
require that restitution be made to any person that has suffered financial injury because of the violation of this article; and
impose any other penalty authorized by this article.
This section does not limit the rights of policyholders or claimants.
